intro: Ixia pumila, commonly known as the dwarf fire lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Ixia pumila is a perennial herb that produces its flowers in late summer to early autumn. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
